Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.server crashes when package id is from GB18030 char-set" (#3159) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @mishra14 on July 22, 2016 23:14_

Repro - 

Start a nuget.server. Add a package with id from GB18030 char-set (e.g. - „êÄ„í£„ï¥„ïµ„ôâ„ôä‰µØ‰µ∞‰∂¥‰∂µ).

The server throws unhandled exception soon after or on adding a new package.

The cause could be due to the move away from nuget core(?)

_Copied from original issue: NuGet/Home#3200_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.Jobs - Refactor JobArgumentNames.cs" (#3073) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Refactor JobArgumentNames.cs so that NuGet.Jobs.Common only holds common argument names. Job-specific argument names should be moved into their respective job.

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/blob/19b7d028bb69d1ccf16e221aeda5fe6b98cc66e3/src/NuGet.Jobs.Common/Configuration/JobArgumentNames.cs

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unnecessary assets file writes can lead to extra design time builds" (#9903) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS UI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 16.8

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Open the NuGet.sln

1. Allowing everything to load. 

1. Run a clean solution, which today, deletes the no-op caches.

1. Run restore.

1. Observe many assets file writes...more thna 50/80 projects. On solution load where lots of restores are "succeeded" as this, this can unfortunately lead to unnecesasry design time builds. 

...

Events.RelatedBody:
---
**Issue moved from dotnet/aspnetcore#24722**
- Please respond to @tebeco.

---

_From @tebeco on Sunday, August 9, 2020 6:51:32 PM_

Hello everyone ;)

### Describe the bug
As I am trying to restore the repository I'm hit by

```
C:\dev\github\tebeco\aspnetcore\.dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-rc.1.20379.10\NuGet.targets(128,5): error : Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json.
C:\dev\github\tebeco\aspnetcore\.dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-rc.1.20379.10\NuGet.targets(128,5): error :   The SSL connection could not be established, see inner exception.
C:\dev\github\tebeco\aspnetcore\.dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-rc.1.20379.10\NuGet.targets(128,5): error :    Received an unexpected EOF or 0 bytes from the transport stream.
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2266487/89739398-a4933000-da80-11ea-8fb8-a45c1d7923f1.png)

It's the second day in a row it happens, and only at the end of the say, not sure if it's related to an outage or a cache somewhere, or ISP ...
The workaround described bellow only worked for less than 24h I would say, and worked again today

### To Reproduce
Follow the docs :
https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/master/docs/BuildFromSource.md
```
> mkdir temp1234
> cd temp1234
> git clone --recursive https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore
> cd aspnetcore

> ./eng/scripts/InstallVisualStudio.ps1 -Channel Preview
> npm i -g yarn
> ./restore.cmd
fails
```
I've just update Windows Insider Dev channel, and I hope there's nothing broken about Certificate :D
Hello everyone ;)

### Describe the bug
As I am trying to restore the repository I'm hit by

```
C:\dev\github\tebeco\aspnetcore\.dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-rc.1.20379.10\NuGet.targets(128,5): error : Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json.
C:\dev\github\tebeco\aspnetcore\.dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-rc.1.20379.10\NuGet.targets(128,5): error :   The SSL connection could not be established, see inner exception.
C:\dev\github\tebeco\aspnetcore\.dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-rc.1.20379.10\NuGet.targets(128,5): error :    Received an unexpected EOF or 0 bytes from the transport stream.
```

### To Reproduce
Follow the docs :
https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/master/docs/BuildFromSource.md
```
> mkdir temp1234
> cd temp1234
> git clone --recursive https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore
> cd aspnetcore

> ./eng/scripts/InstallVisualStudio.ps1 -Channel Preview
> npm i -g yarn
> ./restore.cmd
fails
```
I've just update Windows Insider Dev channel, and I hope there's nothing broken about Certificate :D

### More digging
It seems to fail on `dotnet tool restore` (At first)
Yesterday I had the exact same issue
* ran `dotnet tool restore`  => takes VERY LONG TIME => same error
* deleted `global.json` => `dotnet tool restore` => went weird because `dotnet/arcade`
* `dotnet nuget locals --clear all` => same issue

### Workaround
Editing `global.json` to use `preview7` (because, well I also use `preview7` on side project)
From:
```json
{
  "sdk": {
    "version": "5.0.100-rc.1.20379.10"
  },
  "tools": {
    "dotnet": "5.0.100-rc.1.20379.10",
...
```
To preview7
```json
{
  "sdk": {
    "version": "5.0.100-preview.7.20366.6"
  },
  "tools": {
    "dotnet": "5.0.100-preview.7.20366.6",
```

At that time `restore.cmd` works and if I `git checkout global.json` and re-run `restore.cmd` it works again.
I don't get it

### Further technical details
- ASP.NET Core version
  `master` (commit `983e7ed635f4d128edce4191b51869bd7be8aced`)

- Include the output of `dotnet --info`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Feature request - Option to update user global packages folder automatically after successful pack" (#9891) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet product used: NuGet.exe | VS UI
NuGet version 5.6.0.6591
VS version 16.6.3
OS version Windows Server 2019

1. Setup 2 solutions each with a project so that one project has a package reference to the other. Project A depends on Project B via nuget package reference. Set GeneratePackageOnBuild to true in Project B.

2. Make changes to project B and build it. 
Then go back to Project A and rebuild it. The previous change in project B is not reflected in project A.

Expectation: The change in project B should reflect in project A so I can test it and finally check in.

Suggested feature:
When the nupkg is generated for project B after successful build, it should (optionally) update the nuget user cache as well, overwriting if the same version already exists.

Local package source option doesn't work either as it would require increasing version every time project B is changed. If version is not increased it would use the older code of the same version from the nuget cache. After the successful testing, I would normally check in and the package version would be increased.

Keeping both projects in the same solution is also not a good idea, as that would mean all the projects referencing project B should be in the same solution as B which defeats the purpose of nuget reference.

Workaround:
We ended up implementing a custom target that deletes the package in the nuget cache and updates it with the newly built pack. It would be nice to have this feature built in.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet restore memory allocations causes frequent GC which leads to UI delays and slow performance" (#1335) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Some large projects (cough, Roslyn, cough) may want to disable restore on build support because restore takes a long time.  However, it would be nice to have that be something configured by the project, instead of it being a per-user setting that we have to tell everyone who clones our solution to go change.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
